intro: Rimaria angusta, commonly known as narrow rimaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant has slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Rimaria angusta is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
